description:
The Manager, Software Quality Engineering professional will play a key role in supporting all members of the Program Delivery Branch on the Program Quality Assurance team.
· Language: Bilingual English and French Imperative (CBC)· Location: Hybrid (Ottawa, ON)· Tenure:  Casual
Core Responsibilities:

 Quality Assurance Strategy: Develop and implement a comprehensive quality assurance strategy aligned with the DPM3 and IRCC’s goals and objectives. This strategy should include quality policies, procedures, and performance metrics.
 Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of quality engineers. Provide guidance, training, and support to ensure they are equipped to perform their duties effectively.
 Quality Standards Compliance: Ensure that DPM3 deliverables to established standards and client requirements. Monitor changes in standards and scope of projects and make necessary adjustments.
 Quality Verification: Conduct regular verification of processes, systems, and deliveries to identify areas for improvement and ensure adherence to quality standards. Develop and maintain an verification schedule and report findings to relevant stakeholders.
 Process Improvement: Continuously improve quality assurance processes. Identify opportunities to reduce defects, and enhance overall efficiency.
 Root Cause Analysis: Lead in the investigation of , and address the root causes of quality issues and non-conformities. Develop and implement corrective and preventive action plans to prevent recurrence.
 Vendor and Consultant Management: Collaborate with procurement team to onboard consultants and put contracts in place when needed. Monitor consultants deliverables are on point.
 Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of quality-related data, including test results, and defect and quality trends. Generate and communicate quality reports to management and relevant stakeholders. Lead the implementation and maintenance of methods of procedure for the Quality Engineers
 Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks to deliveries and contribute to risk mitigation strategies. This may include assessing the impact of design changes, client requirement variations, or other factors.
 Client Feedback: Collect and analyze client feedback and complaints related to product quality. Use this information to drive continuous improvement initiatives and enhance client satisfaction.
 Training and Development: Ensure that quality engineering staff receive adequate training and development opportunities to stay current with industry trends and best practices. Foster a culture of continuous learning.
 Cost Control: Manage the team’s budget efficiently. Identify cost-effective ways to maintain or improve quality without excessive expenditures.
 Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other stakeholders, such as development team, Infrastructure and Operations, clients, IT security, Architecture to integrate quality considerations into the verification process.
 Performance Metrics: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and track quality performance. Regularly review and analyze these metrics to drive improvements.
 Continuous Improvement Culture: Promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement throughout the organization. Encourage employees at all levels to actively contribute to quality enhancement efforts.

Requirements:

 Previous experience leading a Software Quality Engineering team or working as a Software Quality Engineer
 Language requirement: Bilingual Imperative (CBC/CBC)

Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

 Company pension
 Dental care
 Paid time off
 Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Overtime pay

Experience:

 Leadership: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

 French (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Ottawa, ON K1P 6A6
Application deadline: 2023-10-20Expected start date: 2023-11-13
